events.comment: Elementos de UI
Eventos del Jugador
Enemigo Comportamiento
Danio Enemigo

objects.name: Conversacin
objects.string:
Hola Amigo, bienvenido a esta nueva aventura, donde tendras que rescatar a la princesa "Banana".
Deseas aceptar la misin? o te abres como empanada?

content.text:
Hola Amigo, bienvenido a esta nueva aventura, donde tendras que rescatar a la princesa "Banana".
Deseas aceptar la misin? o te abres como empanada?

parameters: "ERES UN RIFADO, VETE POR LA PRINCESA Y RESCATALA"
"CHALE PENSE QUE ERAS VALIENTE! DE SEGURO ESTUDIAS EN TECNOLOGAS"

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com, @bouh
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for text ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Reveal a text one letter after the other.
description: Reveal a text one letter after the other (a "typewriter" effect).
It can be used for dialogue scenes or visual novels.
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).
- The 3 behaviors has been merged into a unique one.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Reveal a text one letter after the other.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: AutoTyping

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the full text has been typed.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFinished

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a character has just been typed. Useful for triggering sound effects.
eventsFunctions.name: HasJustTyped

eventsFunctions.description: Restart typing from the beginning of text. The autotyping also start automatically when a new text is set for the object.
eventsFunctions.name: RestartFromBeginning
eventsFunctions.sentence: Restart typing from the beginning on _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Jump to a specific position in the text. Positions start at "0" and increase by one for every character.
eventsFunctions.name: JumpToPosition

eventsFunctions.description: Show the full text.
eventsFunctions.name: ShowFullText

eventsFunctions.description: the time between characters beign typed.
eventsFunctions.name: Interval

propertyDescriptors.label: Detect if a new text character was just displayed
propertyDescriptors.name: CharacterJustAdded

Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: PanelSpriteButton
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A button that can be customized.
description: The button can be customized with a background for each state and a label. It handles user interactions and a simple condition can be used to check if it is clicked.
There are ready-to-use buttons in the asset-store [menu buttons pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=menu-buttons-menu-buttons).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: The finite state machine used internally by the button object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonFSM

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

propertyDescriptors.description: Should check hovering
propertyDescriptors.name: ShouldCheckHovering

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.name: SetLabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label text.
eventsFunctions.name: LabelText

eventsFunctions.description: Return the label center Y according to the button configuration. This expression is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is pressed or released.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterWithPaddingY

eventsFunctions.description: Center the label according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
eventsFunctions.name: CenterLabel

eventsFunctions.description: De/activate interactions with the button.
eventsFunctions.name: Activate

eventsFunctions.description: Check if interactions are activated on the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsActivated

propertyDescriptors.label: Label offset on Y axis when pressed
propertyDescriptors.name: PressedLabelOffsetY

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
- Inanimate objects (for insance breakable doors or mining rocks)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points, shield and armor.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

events.comment: Health
Correct any values above maximum limits
Shield
Correct any values above maximum limits

events.name: Remove shield points if shield expired

eventsFunctions.description: Apply damage to the object. Shield and armor can reduce this damage if enabled.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit
eventsFunctions.sentence: Apply _PARAM2_ points of damage to _PARAM0_ (Damage can be reduced by Shield: _PARAM3_, Armor: _PARAM4_)

events.comment: Only consider incoming damage when damage cooldown is not active
No damage will be applied when dodged
If shield is active, damage the shield first
If damage is less than shield, subtract damage from shield.
If damage is greater than shield, conditionally apply excess damage based on property
Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctions.description: current health points of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object by increasing its health points.

events.comment: If Max Health is not set, do not enforce Max Health
If Max Health is set and Overhealing is not allowed
Perform heal
Update healing trigger

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian, Entropy, VegeTato
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make an object flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
description: Make an object flash for a period of time so that it alternates between two different states.
Includes the ability to flash visibility (blink), color tint, object effect, or opacity (fade).
After adding a behavior to an object, you **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
- Let players know they are invincible after being hit
- Catch player attention on the interface (for instance a "press start" text)

eventsFunctions.description: Color tint applied to an object.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Color tint applied to an object
eventsFunctions.name: ColorTint

events.comment: Return the color string for the tint applied to the object

eventsFunctions.name: IsTinted

eventsFunctions.description: Toggle color tint between the starting tint and a given value.
eventsFunctions.name: ToggleColorTint

events.name: Note: This function cannot be "public" until it properly handles objects without a starting color tint variable (NULL)
Swap between the starting tint and the given value

eventsFunctions.name: ToggleVisibility
